hero.title: Growing quality from the land
hero.subtitle: We are a family agricultural company dedicated to responsible farming, combining experience, fieldwork, and a vision for the future.

whoWeAre.heading: Who we are
whoWeAre.paragraph1: ALCEMA is a family-owned agricultural company with over 100 years of history, dedicated exclusively to organic vegetable production under a regenerative and sustainable agriculture model.
whoWeAre.paragraph2: We are a third-generation company, deeply rooted in the Mayo Valley in Huatabampo, Sonora, where we combine tradition, innovation, and respect for the land.
whoWeAre.paragraph3: Our commitment is to produce high-quality food while caring for the soil, water, and the people who are part of our operation.

ourHistory.heading: Our history
ourHistory.paragraph1: Our story begins in 1920, when Don Eugenio Larr√≠naga, a Basque immigrant, discovered the fertile lands of the Lower Mayo River. A visionary and pioneer, he succeeded in exporting vegetables‚Äîmainly tomatoes‚Äîto the United States during World War II, establishing himself as one of the most innovative farmers in the valley.
ourHistory.paragraph2: Over the years, the family faced great challenges, such as droughts and lack of water infrastructure, which drove the exploration of new valleys and production methods. With the construction of the Adolfo Ruiz Cortines Dam in 1959, the region found stability and agricultural growth.
ourHistory.paragraph3: In 1980, following the 1976 land reform, Don Cesar Larr√≠naga decided to divide the lands among his children, formally founding ALCEMA, a name that emerges from the family union and remains to this day as a symbol of resilience, hard work, and generational continuity.

vision.heading: Vision and sustainability
vision.paragraph1: Our vision is clear: produce responsibly today, to ensure a fertile tomorrow.
vision.paragraph2: Aware that agriculture has limits, we have completely transformed our operation toward a sustainable and regenerative model, focused on:
vision.implement1: Drip irrigation, sprinklers, and precision agriculture
vision.implement2: Minimum tillage to protect soil life
vision.implement4: Crop rotation (3 to 5 cycles) and green manures
vision.implement5: Biological control through habitat and beneficial flowers
vision.paragraph3: We care not only for the land, but also for our surroundings and collaborators, promoting safety, training, and recycling.
vision.paragraph4: Today, ALCEMA is advancing with new projects focused on reducing energy consumption and oil dependency, honoring the entrepreneurial spirit of Don Eugenio and the legacy of Don Cesar, while sowing the future for the next generations.

ccof.title: CCOF - Organic Certification
ccof.description: Organic certification that verifies our processes comply with strict international standards for soil management, biodiversity protection, and the responsible use of inputs, ensuring production free from prohibited substances.

primusgfs.title: PrimusGFS - Food Safety
primusgfs.description: International standard recognized by the Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI) that certifies our good agricultural practices, hygienic handling, and food safety systems, ensuring safe products from the field to the customer.

fairTrade.title: Fair Trade - Fair Trade Certification
fairTrade.description: Certification that promotes fair working conditions, respect for labor rights, and community development through responsible and transparent commercial practices.
